title: Introduction to electricity
description: University level course on how electricity works. Covers the fundamental concepts of voltage, current, resistance, power, energy, and their relationships, with a focus on practical applications and circuit analysis.

modules.title: Fundamentals of Electric Charge and Current
modules.description: This module introduces the basic concepts of electric charge, current, and voltage, laying the foundation for understanding electrical circuits.

topics.title: Overview
topics.description: Course introduction and objectives.

topics.title: Electric Charge and Coulomb's Law
topics.description: Understanding the nature of electric charge and the force between charges.

topics.title: Electric Field
topics.description: Introduction to the electric field and its properties.

topics.title: Electric Potential Energy and Potential Difference
topics.description: Defining electric potential energy and potential difference.

topics.title: Current and Drift Velocity
topics.description: Understanding the flow of electric charge and drift velocity of charge carriers.

topics.title: Voltage and Electromotive Force (EMF)
topics.description: Defining voltage and its relation to energy and EMF.

topics.title: Conventional Current vs. Electron Flow
topics.description: Understanding the difference between conventional current and electron flow.

topics.title: Introduction to Circuit Symbols
topics.description: Familiarizing yourself with common circuit symbols.

topics.title: Electrical Safety
topics.description: An overview of electrical safety practices.

topics.title: Module 1 Problem Set
topics.description: Practice problems for Module 1.

topics.title: Module 1 Quiz
topics.description: A quiz on the contents of Module 1.

modules.title: Resistance and Ohm's Law
modules.description: This module explores the concept of resistance and its relationship to voltage and current through Ohm's Law.

topics.title: Resistance and Resistivity
topics.description: Defining resistance and resistivity.

topics.title: Ohm's Law
topics.description: Understanding the relationship between voltage, current, and resistance.

topics.title: Factors Affecting Resistance
topics.description: Exploring factors like temperature, material, and geometry that affect resistance.

topics.title: Resistors in Series
topics.description: Calculating the total resistance of resistors connected in series.

topics.title: Resistors in Parallel
topics.description: Calculating the total resistance of resistors connected in parallel.

topics.title: Voltage Dividers
topics.description: Understanding and designing voltage divider circuits.

topics.title: Current Dividers
topics.description: Understanding and designing current divider circuits.

topics.title: Power Dissipation in Resistors
topics.description: Calculating the power dissipated by resistors.

topics.title: Linearity and Superposition
topics.description: Applying the concepts of linearity and superposition to circuit analysis.

topics.title: Module 2 Problem Set
topics.description: Practice problems for Module 2.

topics.title: Module 2 Quiz
topics.description: A quiz on the contents of Module 2.

topics.title: Types of Resistors
topics.description: Explore different types of resistors and their applications.

modules.title: DC Circuits and Kirchhoff's Laws
modules.description: This module covers the analysis of DC circuits using Kirchhoff's Laws and other circuit analysis techniques.

topics.title: Kirchhoff's Current Law (KCL)
topics.description: Understanding and applying Kirchhoff's Current Law.

topics.title: Kirchhoff's Voltage Law (KVL)
topics.description: Understanding and applying Kirchhoff's Voltage Law.

topics.title: Series Circuits Analysis
topics.description: Analyzing series circuits using KVL and Ohm's Law.

topics.title: Parallel Circuits Analysis
topics.description: Analyzing parallel circuits using KCL and Ohm's Law.

topics.title: Series-Parallel Circuits
topics.description: Analyzing series-parallel combination circuits.

topics.title: Nodal Analysis
topics.description: Solving circuits using nodal analysis.

topics.title: Mesh Analysis
topics.description: Solving circuits using mesh analysis.

topics.title: Source Transformations
topics.description: Simplifying circuits using source transformations.

topics.title: Thevenin's Theorem
topics.description: Applying Thevenin's Theorem to simplify circuits.

topics.title: Norton's Theorem
topics.description: Applying Norton's Theorem to simplify circuits.

topics.title: Module 3 Problem Set
topics.description: Practice problems for Module 3.

topics.title: Module 3 Quiz
topics.description: A quiz on the contents of Module 3.

modules.title: Energy and Power in Electric Circuits
modules.description: This module focuses on energy and power calculations in DC circuits, including maximum power transfer.

topics.title: Electrical Work and Energy
topics.description: Understanding the concepts of electrical work and energy.

topics.title: Power in DC Circuits
topics.description: Calculating power in DC circuits.

topics.title: Energy Dissipation in Resistors
topics.description: Calculating energy dissipation in resistors over time.

topics.title: Power Supplies and Batteries
topics.description: Understanding the characteristics of power supplies and batteries.

topics.title: Maximum Power Transfer Theorem
topics.description: Applying the maximum power transfer theorem.

topics.title: Efficiency in Electrical Circuits
topics.description: Calculating the efficiency of electrical circuits.

topics.title: Module 4 Problem Set
topics.description: Practice problems for Module 4.

topics.title: Module 4 Quiz
topics.description: A quiz on the contents of Module 4.

topics.title: Grounding and Electrical Safety
topics.description: Understanding the importance of grounding for safety.

topics.title: Short Circuits and Overloads
topics.description: Understanding the dangers of short circuits and overloads.

modules.title: Capacitance and Inductance
modules.description: This module introduces capacitors and inductors, their properties, and their behavior in DC circuits.

topics.title: Capacitance and Capacitors
topics.description: Defining capacitance and exploring different types of capacitors.

topics.title: Capacitors in Series and Parallel
topics.description: Calculating equivalent capacitance for series and parallel combinations.

topics.title: Energy Stored in a Capacitor
topics.description: Calculating the energy stored in a capacitor.

topics.title: Charging and Discharging Capacitors
topics.description: Analyzing the charging and discharging process of capacitors.

topics.title: Inductance and Inductors
topics.description: Defining inductance and exploring different types of inductors.

topics.title: Inductors in Series and Parallel
topics.description: Calculating equivalent inductance for series and parallel combinations.

topics.title: Energy Stored in an Inductor
topics.description: Calculating the energy stored in an inductor.

topics.title: RL and RC Time Constants
topics.description: Understanding the concept of time constants in RL and RC circuits.

topics.title: Module 5 Problem Set
topics.description: Practice problems for Module 5.

topics.title: Module 5 Quiz
topics.description: A quiz on the contents of Module 5.

topics.title: Applications of Capacitors and Inductors
topics.description: Explore real world applications of capacitors and inductors.

topics.title: Parasitic Capacitance and Inductance
topics.description: Understand how parasitic capacitance and inductance can affect circuits.

modules.title: AC Circuits and Phasors
modules.description: This module introduces alternating current (AC) circuits and the use of phasors for circuit analysis.

topics.title: Sinusoidal Waveforms
topics.description: Understanding sinusoidal waveforms and their characteristics.

topics.title: RMS Values and Average Values
topics.description: Defining RMS and average values of AC waveforms.

topics.title: Phasors and Impedance
topics.description: Introducing phasors and impedance in AC circuits.

topics.title: AC Circuit Analysis Techniques
topics.description: Applying circuit analysis techniques to AC circuits.

topics.title: AC Power
topics.description: Understanding power in AC circuits.

topics.title: Power Factor
topics.description: Defining and improving power factor.

topics.title: Module 6 Problem Set
topics.description: Practice problems for Module 6.

topics.title: Module 6 Quiz
topics.description: A quiz on the contents of Module 6.

topics.title: Reactance of Capacitors and Inductors
topics.description: Understanding the reactance of capacitors and inductors in AC circuits.

topics.title: RLC Series Circuits
topics.description: Analyzing RLC series circuits.

topics.title: RLC Parallel Circuits
topics.description: Analyzing RLC parallel circuits.

topics.title: Resonance in AC Circuits
topics.description: Understanding resonance in AC circuits.

modules.title: Three-Phase Power Systems
modules.description: An introduction to three-phase power systems, their advantages, and basic analysis.

topics.title: Introduction to Three-Phase Systems
topics.description: Understanding the basics of three-phase power systems.

topics.title: Wye and Delta Connections
topics.description: Understanding wye and delta connections in three-phase systems.

topics.title: Line and Phase Voltages and Currents
topics.description: Relating line and phase voltages and currents.

topics.title: Three-Phase Power Calculations
topics.description: Calculating power in three-phase systems.

topics.title: Balanced and Unbalanced Loads
topics.description: Analyzing balanced and unbalanced loads in three-phase systems.

topics.title: Advantages of Three-Phase Power
topics.description: Understanding the advantages of three-phase power over single-phase power.

topics.title: Module 7 Problem Set
topics.description: Practice problems for Module 7.

topics.title: Module 7 Quiz
topics.description: A quiz on the contents of Module 7.

topics.title: Power Distribution Systems
topics.description: Overview of power distribution systems.

topics.title: Transformers in Three-Phase Systems
topics.description: Understanding the role of transformers in three-phase systems.

topics.title: Power System Protection
topics.description: Overview of power system protection schemes.

topics.title: Harmonics in Power Systems
topics.description: Introduction to harmonics in power systems.

modules.title: Capstone Project: Electrical System Design
modules.description: This module is a capstone project where students apply the concepts learned throughout the course to design a small electrical system.

topics.title: Project Overview and Requirements
topics.description: Defining the scope and requirements of the capstone project.

topics.title: Load Analysis and Estimation
topics.description: Estimating the electrical load of the system.

topics.title: Circuit Design and Component Selection
topics.description: Designing the electrical circuits and selecting appropriate components.

topics.title: Power Supply Design
topics.description: Designing the power supply for the system.

topics.title: Wiring and Grounding Design
topics.description: Designing the wiring and grounding system for safety.

topics.title: Protection and Safety Devices
topics.description: Selecting appropriate protection and safety devices.

topics.title: System Simulation and Testing
topics.description: Simulating and testing the designed system.

topics.title: Documentation and Reporting
topics.description: Documenting the design process and writing a final report.

topics.title: Design Review 1
topics.description: Peer review of design progress.

topics.title: Design Review 2
topics.description: Final design review and presentation.

topics.title: Project Submission
topics.description: Submitting the final project report and design files.
